      • partition

        public void partition(int numPartitions)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IPartitioner
        This will partition some input graph (input format is implementation dependant) into the given number of partitions. Specific implementations may be able to choose the number of partitions themselves, but this is not guaranteed. This method must be called only once, and before IPartitioner.getPartitions() is ever called.
        Specified by:
        partition in interface IPartitioner
        Parameters:
        numPartitions - The number of partitions to split the input graph into
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getPartitions

        public Iterable<ISerializablePartition> getPartitions()
                                               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IPartitioner
        Returns an Iterable of partitions that are suitable for writing to disk. It is encouraged that implementations return partitions from the Iterable on demand so that it is possible to keep only a single partition in memory at once.
        Specified by:
        getPartitions in interface IPartitioner
        Returns:
        An Iterable of partitions in a serializable format
        Throws:
        IOException

      • iterator

        public Iterator<ISerializablePartition> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<ISerializablePartition>
